product_overview: Anikku is an open-source, high-performance Android application designed for anime enthusiasts to stream, track, and manage their anime library from multiple sources with seamless integration to popular tracking services.
core_goals: Provide seamless streaming from multiple anime sources via an extensible system.
Enable comprehensive management of anime library including favorites, categories, and offline downloads.
Offer deep integration with anime tracking services such as MyAnimeList and AniList for automatic watch progress syncing.
Deliver a premium user experience with advanced video playback, haptic feedback, and smooth performant UI.
Support robust backup and restore functionality to protect user data and preferences.
key_features: Multi-source anime streaming with an extension architecture enabling scraping from various providers.
Global and source-specific search capabilities to find anime efficiently across all installed sources.
Advanced MPV-based video player supporting gestures, haptics, custom playback speeds, and torrent streaming.
Library management including favorites, custom categorization, and offline viewing with multi-threaded downloads.
Integration with trackers like MAL and AniList for auto synchronization of watch progress and status.
Torrent support through a dedicated TorrentServer component for versatile content consumption.
Backup and restore functionality safeguarding user data and settings.
Customizable UI themes providing personalization options.
Use of modern Android tech stack including Jetpack Compose, Voyager for navigation, SQLDelight for local data storage, and Kotlin as the primary language.
user_flow_summary: User launches the app and is presented with a home screen showing their anime library and recent updates.
User searches for anime using a global search bar that queries all installed streaming sources simultaneously.
User adds anime to their favorites and organizes them into categories for easy access.
User streams anime via the built-in video player with features like gesture controls, haptic feedback, and adjustable playback speed.
User enables tracker integrations to sync watch progress automatically with services like MyAnimeList and AniList.
User downloads episodes for offline viewing with options for multi-threaded download support.
User customizes the app appearance using various themes.
User backs up their library, settings, and progress and restores them when needed.
validation_criteria: No duplicate key crashes during list rendering in the UI.
Maintain frame time below 16 milliseconds to ensure 60fps smooth animation.
Successful synchronization of watch progress with external trackers like MAL and AniList.
Verification of multi-source streaming working correctly through installed extensions.
Confirmation of download functionality supporting multi-threading without errors.
Backup and restore procedures preserve user data accurately and are tested for reliability.
Torrent support functions correctly with the TorrentServer component.
UI themes apply properly and customization persists across sessions.
